title: Breath Below the Harps
description: Ayo Solace proposes a remedy with equal parts science and scandal. The Syrinx Wind Courts are tuned in public, but under the flutes lies a sealed subchamber that hoards the city’s breath—the same illicit cache Tallea once dared to steal from. A controlled draw from that chamber, Ayo claims, could be mixed with enzyme and echo-stone to make a calibration tincture for the Heliolith’s pulse. But the Ledger keeps keys and schedules, and a single misstep in timing will spill the plan into the harps where truth becomes case law. To listen under law is to skate on glass humming with power.
objectives: Acquire a midnight access window to the Syrinx subchamber by persuading wind-scribe Rhyss Quell.
Synchronize with the aeolian harps and open the subchamber between notes without tripping the bell-scribes.
Mix a small vial of breath-tincture using Solace enzymes on-site.
Evade Ledger auditors led by Dorel Glassant and exit before the hour turns.

dialogue.quest_giver_to_hero: Ayo leans close enough for her balm to cool your cheek. "I will not sanctify theft, Tallea. But I will sanctify a cure. The Courts have been collecting our breath for years in the name of record. If we draw a cup and return a cure that steadies the Courts themselves, who can object with a straight face? You time the lulls better than any clerk alive. I can mix the breath into a tincture that will teach your fork the city’s average note. Meet me at moon-tier, and bring courage dry enough not to squeak."
dialogue.hero_reply: Tallea’s throat tightens around a memory of a stolen vial. "If I step under the harps, I will hear every lie I ever spoke echo back at me. I’ll still go. Rhyss owes me a favor for the chain-pass audit and he hates the Ledger’s long fingers as much as I do. We do this clean, Ayo. If the harps catch us, we speak the plan aloud and dare the city to call it a crime."

npc_interjections.name: Rhyss Quell
npc_interjections.line: Rhyss rubs the back of his neck where ribbon burns scar his skin. "You’re asking me to breathe wrong in the very place I teach people how to breathe right. Fine. I’ll hold the lull open for a count of seven. If you miss it, I will testify we came to fix a leak, and I will hate you for making me lie so pretty."

npc_interjections.name: Dorel Glassant
npc_interjections.line: Dorel’s eyes gleam with late-hour lamplight. "A tincture to bind the city’s breath into a single metric? Poetic, and, you must admit, very useful for underwriting. Don’t look so betrayed, Tallea. We both collect patterns. Only I’m honest about why."

dialogue.ambient: The wind harps sing like glass arteries, and in the beat between notes you can hear footfalls, heartbeats, and the legal weight of words waiting to be spoken.

rewards: Minor Favor (Rhyss Quell): 1 use in Wind Courts
